randgeo 0.3.0

Introduction to the randgeo package

Scott Chamberlain, Noam Ross, and Samuel Bosch

2018-05-18

Source: vignettes/randgeo_vignette.Rmd
randgeo_vignette.Rmd

randgeo is a no dependency R package for generating random lat/long positions, or random WKT or GeoJSON points or polygons.

The benefit of no dependencies is that it can easily be used in other packages without any pain. e.g., you may want to show examples in your package but you don’t want a heavy dependency just for examples.

This package is adapted from Javascript’s https://github.com/tmcw/geojson-random but with modifications.

Install

Stable randgeo version from CRAN

install.packages("randgeo")

Or, the development version from Github

devtools::install_github("ropensci/randgeo")
library("randgeo")

random position

rg_position()
#> [[1]]
#> [1] -91.67649  15.46011

Many positions

rg_position(10)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] -118.83755  -11.59579
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 163.42678 -21.30695
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 104.08393 -80.84643
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] -45.46406  40.08128
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1]  7.308097 -9.027415
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] -36.60053 -18.25741
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] -106.76103  -36.58675
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] 149.66602  46.11848
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1] 133.75164  35.22518
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] -137.26169   49.45633

Random position within a bounding box

rg_position(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 52.32923 57.22208

Well-known text

random points

A single point

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (-123.3908044 3.0300935)"

Many points

wkt_point(count = 10)
#>  [1] "POINT (145.1483063 49.5659979)"  "POINT (-62.0664730 -19.0378540)"
#>  [3] "POINT (173.2884376 19.5288828)"  "POINT (-137.5398865 37.4172704)"
#>  [5] "POINT (-8.1417756 7.7153674)"    "POINT (-133.7346676 23.3315788)"
#>  [7] "POINT (-19.6522429 18.1214689)"  "POINT (-125.9329798 19.5580336)"
#>  [9] "POINT (-112.7918200 4.7460979)"  "POINT (-58.7670518 26.8174466)"

Within a bounding box

wkt_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [1] "POINT (56.1408327 51.3218040)"

The fmt parameter controls how many decimal points

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (-100.5851586 6.2538484)"
wkt_point(fmt = 10)
#> [1] "POINT (148.1126737967 -35.7140377929)"

random polygons

wkt_polygon()
#> [1] "POLYGON ((50.6591772 -74.4500547, 56.0499331 -77.9159884, 60.0580330 -82.4853073, 110.0859367 -82.0035832, 77.8236493 -84.3517599, 39.0519940 -87.9694664, 25.3017176 -85.9229768, -10.0485932 -84.6075497, 23.9403248 -82.2412616, 32.1647501 -81.6210722, 50.6591772 -74.4500547))"

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-83.3262193 61.8528229, -82.8914138 60.5268271, -83.7173724 51.2001338, -93.3390830 60.3616744, -83.3262193 61.8528229))"

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(max_radial_length = 5)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-89.2312813 -11.7037300, -88.4905121 -10.7161210, -87.5048223 -11.3025981, -88.5465849 -15.9252172, -87.7955549 -18.3344001, -89.7387691 -13.8441655, -92.4534885 -11.5757138, -90.2138955 -13.1958077, -91.9242212 -10.7835503, -89.8451655 -12.9235363, -89.2312813 -11.7037300))"

Within a bounding box

wkt_polygon(bbox = c(-130, 50, -120, 60))
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-128.9313855 62.8226622, -124.0266728 60.1397744, -121.5731001 58.7186177, -128.7371220 53.3825482, -117.7631206 52.8861217, -123.0398614 53.0294344, -131.4261643 50.6097606, -136.9057940 49.4324975, -139.6947967 51.5521597, -133.7705515 55.5439624, -128.9313855 62.8226622))"

GeoJSON

random points

A single point

geo_point()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 178.308939   2.136669
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

Many points

geo_point(count = 10)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
...

Within a bounding box

geo_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 57.82125 54.91941
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

random polygons

geo_polygon()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] -170.36486  -30.22639
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] -167.86619  -31.46597
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] -169.24533  -34.55356
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] -168.51073  -36.05501
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] -166.29148  -40.12294
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[6]]
#> [1] 179.80275 -39.91911
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[7]]
#> [1] -179.22962  -37.29404
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[8]]
#> [1] -177.45059  -35.63585
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[9]]
#> [1] -176.5218  -31.5983
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[10]]
#> [1] -175.70122  -32.63338

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

geo_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]

#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type

#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] -163.8160  -22.2685
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] -169.36536  -12.88249
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] -162.63559  -14.51864
#>

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)
